meanings.definition: To make, sell, or transport illicit goods.
meanings.sent1: He tried to bootleg DVDs to make some quick money.
meanings.sent2: The criminals were caught bootlegging alcohol across state lines.
meanings.sent3: The kids joked that they would bootleg candy from the store.
meanings.sent4: She decided to bootleg her homemade cookies at the school bake sale.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain would bootleg treasures from other ships.

meanings.definition: An illegal copy or recording of a product.
meanings.sent1: I found a bootleg of the concert online for cheap.
meanings.sent2: The market was flooded with bootleg movies.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally bought a bootleg copy of the popular game.
meanings.sent4: The street vendor was selling bootleg designer handbags.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a collection of bootleg paintings.

meanings.sent1: She enjoyed listening to bootlegs of live concerts.
meanings.sent2: The bootleg of the band's performance was of poor quality.
meanings.sent3: He proudly showed off his collection of bootleg music albums.
meanings.sent4: The bootleg video of the event went viral on social media.
meanings.sent5: The fans eagerly traded bootleg recordings of the show.
